sentences.sContent: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.sCn: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.sContent: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.sCn: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

sentences.sContent: ...What do we learn about the audience at the meeting...
...I ask my audience to let me know...
...having an audience increases the chances that you will continue to do well...
...When does the presence of an audience facilitate your performance according to Roberts...
...The subjects who had an audience did worse than the subjects who did alone...
...having an audience increases the chances that you will continue to do badly...
...having an audience helps you do it better...
...Roberts found that the presence of an audience facilitates what you already know how to do...
...an American artist was giving a speech on the art of Japanese brush painting to an audience that included visitors from Japan...
...What do we learn about the audience at the meeting...

phrases.pCn: 目标受众；目标观众；目标客户
受制而走不开的听众或观众

remMethod.val: audi(听) ＋ ence → 听的人 → 听众

trans.tranOther: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work
